content: I can't say whether you'll enjoy the taste of mopane worms, but they are a unique namibian delicacy worth trying if you're feeling adventurous. they are high in protein and commonly eaten in southern africa. they can be eaten raw, but they are usually cooked or dried for preservation. when cooked, they are often sautéed with garlic, onion, and a spice blend to add flavor. some people say they have a nutty taste, while others describe them as having a crunchy texture. while mopane worms may not be for everyone, they are an important source of protein for many people in southern africa and are also an environmentally sustainable source of food.
